quest.name: A Light That Never Goes Out
journal:
 Quest Sync
Spurius is in the mood to brighten this dreary place up, though he lacks the materials necessary to do so.

dialogue.name: SPURIUS
dialogue.text: There's something about the darkness that just deflates the spirits, wouldn't you say? We have plenty of lights, yes, but they use the same fuel as the heaters. And “not freezing to death” places somewhat higher on the agenda than “making the place look nice.”

dialogue.name: SPURIUS
dialogue.text: As such, I've taken it upon myself to craft lanterns that use other sorts of fuel! I was, once upon a time, a technician in the imperial army, so provided I have the glassware, I'm more than capable of the task.

dialogue.name: SPURIUS
dialogue.text: That's where the trouble lies, though. Such items are in short supply, and while I know where in the city we might scrounge up some, I wouldn't dare march into that sea of magitek weaponry. Perhaps you could go in my stead?

dialogue.name: SPURIUS
dialogue.text: Just northwest of the station you'll find a tavern and a perfumery─or what's left of them, anyway. Somewhere among the ruins you should be able to find wares suitable for our lanterns.

dialogue.name: SPURIUS
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, the whole place is crawling with mechanical monstrosities, but you look like you can handle yourself. There should be a few good pieces of glassware remaining somewhere among all that rubble, surely.

dialogue.name: SPURIUS
dialogue.text: Ah, good to see you returned─and unharmed, at that! How did your search go? Well, I hope.

dialogue.name: SPURIUS
dialogue.text: Let us see here. Ah, an old bottle of spirits, though not a drop left to drink. A pity, that. Anyhow, the size is perfect for my purposes.

dialogue.name: SPURIUS
dialogue.text: Now, what do we have here? Ah, a perfume bottle. A touch on the small side, no getting around that, but usable in its own way. Oh, smell that? It's managed to retain some of its scent. Imagine the aroma it will produce once we've added heat!

dialogue.name: SPURIUS
dialogue.text: As you know, for the Garleans, the flame is all. It is said that when our ancestors first arrived in this blighted, frigid land, they lived long in darkness, unable to breathe fire into their world.

dialogue.name: SPURIUS
dialogue.text: What they lacked in magic, though, they made up for in guile. They took what fat and oils they could from the animals of these wilds and chased away their shadows. Until, of course, they at last learned to extract ceruleum from Cerulea Ingens.

dialogue.name: SPURIUS
dialogue.text: But like those first settlers before me, I will carve out a bright spot of hope in this darkness with these lanterns. Thank you for all that you've done, truly.
